explanation.title: DISC Behavioral Styles Assessment
explanation.description: DISC is a behavioral assessment tool that helps identify your natural behavioral style and communication preferences in four main dimensions.
explanation.whatItMeans: This assessment reveals your dominant behavioral style and how you typically interact with others in different situations.

D.name: Dominance (D)
D.description: You are a direct, decisive, and results-oriented person. You prefer to take control of situations and make quick decisions. You are competitive, goal-focused, and comfortable with challenges and risks.

I.name: Influence (I)
I.description: You are a sociable, optimistic, and enthusiastic person. You excel at motivating others and building relationships. You are creative, expressive, and prefer collaborative environments where you can interact with people.

S.name: Steadiness (S)
S.description: You are a calm, patient, and loyal person. You value stability and consistency in both work and relationships. You are a good listener, supportive teammate, and prefer predictable environments.

C.name: Conscientiousness (C)
C.description: You are a precise, analytical, and organized person. You pay attention to details and prefer structured approaches. You value accuracy, quality standards, and systematic processes.

interpretation.dominant: Your main profile is {{profile}}. This indicates a strong tendency to act and think in the manner described above.
interpretation.general: Your DISC profile reveals your natural behavioral preferences and communication style.

testInfluence.bulkDeleteDescription: This will keep your 10 most recent tests and remove all older ones. This helps declutter your profile while preserving recent results.

openness.name: Openness to Experience
openness.title: Openness
openness.description: You are open to new experiences, creative and adventurous.
openness.high: Creative, curious, and open to new ideas and experiences.
openness.low: Prefers familiar routines and traditional approaches.

conscientiousness.name: Conscientiousness
conscientiousness.title: Conscientiousness
conscientiousness.description: You are more flexible and spontaneous, but sometimes less organized.
conscientiousness.low: More flexible and spontaneous, but sometimes less organized.

extraversion.name: Extraversion
extraversion.title: Extraversion
extraversion.description: You are energetic, sociable and like to be the center of attention.
extraversion.high: Sociable, energetic, optimistic and seeks social stimulation.
extraversion.low: More reserved, prefers quieter environments and smaller groups.

agreeableness.name: Agreeableness
agreeableness.title: Agreeableness
agreeableness.description: You are cooperative, empathetic and like to help others.
agreeableness.low: More skeptical, competitive and focuses on personal interests.

neuroticism.name: Neuroticism
neuroticism.title: Neuroticism
neuroticism.description: You are emotionally stable, calm and handle stress well.
neuroticism.high: More prone to anxiety, stress and emotional instability.
neuroticism.low: Emotionally stable, calm and handles stress well.

bigFive.explanationsSubtitle: Understand what each dimension means and how you score

recommendations.specific: Specific recommendations based on your result

bigFive.channelCreativityDesc: Your high openness score means you flourish in creative and diverse environments.
bigFive.valorizeStabilityDesc: Your preference for routine and structure can be an advantage in many contexts.
bigFive.valorizeProductivityDesc: Your organization and discipline are major assets in career and personal life.
bigFive.developFlexibilityDesc: Your flexible style can benefit from simple structures that don't limit you.
bigFive.energizeThroughInteractionDesc: Your social energy is a valuable resource for personal and professional development.
bigFive.valorizeDeepReflectionDesc: Your introverted tendency allows for deep analysis and independent thinking.
bigFive.developSelfAwarenessDesc: Use Big Five results to better understand your motivations and behaviors.
developSelfAwarenessActions: Observe how you react in various situations

lifeImpact.title: Impact on your daily life
lifeImpact.subtitle: How this result can manifest in different aspects of life

bigFive.overallImpact: Your Big Five profile offers a comprehensive perspective on how your personality influences all aspects of life, from career to relationships and personal development.

progressPath.title: Your progress plan
progressPath.subtitle: Concrete steps for improvement and monitoring

bigFive.understandProfileDesc: Analyze each Big Five dimension and identify how it manifests in your daily behavior.
bigFive.valorizeStrengthsDesc: Focus on how you can use your strengths more effectively: {{strengths}}.
bigFive.developBalanceDesc: Explore strategies to bring more balance to: {{weaknesses}}.
bigFive.buildSimpleOrganizationDesc: Implement 1-2 simple organization systems that don't restrict you.
bigFive.expandSocialNetworkDesc: Participate in new events and build connections in areas of interest.
bigFive.developDeepRelationshipsDesc: Invest quality time in 2-3 relationships that are important to you.
bigFive.exploreNewTerritoriesDesc: Try 2-3 activities or hobbies that are completely new to you.
bigFive.evaluateProgressDesc: Analyze how your behaviors and attitudes have evolved in recent months.
bigFive.weeklyReflectionJournal: Keep a weekly personality reflection journal
bigFive.monthlyFeedback: Request monthly feedback from 2-3 close people
bigFive.observeStrengths: Observe and note moments when you use your strengths
bigFive.useTrackingApps: Use simple tracking apps to build habits
bigFive.retestRecommendation: Re-test after 8-12 months to see your personality evolution and strategy effectiveness.

scoring.title: How the score is calculated
scoring.description: Explanation of the evaluation system for this test
scoring.testDescription: The Big Five test evaluates five main dimensions of personality: Openness, Conscientiousness, Extraversion, Agreeableness and Neuroticism.
scoring.resultMeaning: Your results indicate your general Big Five profile and your strengths in various dimensions of personality.

overallScore.title: Test Result: {{testName}}
overallScore.description: Your test results provide valuable insights into your personality and behavior patterns.

bigFive.explanationsSubtitle: Understand what each dimension means and how you position yourself

openness.title: Openness
openness.description: Measures creativity, curiosity, and openness to new experiences
openness.high: Creative, imaginative, curious about new ideas and experiences
openness.low: Prefer routine and traditions, being more conservative in approaches

conscientiousness.title: Conscientiousness
conscientiousness.description: Measures organization, discipline, and goal orientation
conscientiousness.low: More flexible and spontaneous, but sometimes less organized

extraversion.title: Extraversion
extraversion.high: Sociable, assertive, energetic in social interactions
extraversion.low: Prefer solitary activities and are more reserved socially

agreeableness.title: Agreeableness
agreeableness.high: Cooperative, empathetic and like to help others
agreeableness.low: More competitive and direct in interpersonal relationships

neuroticism.title: Neuroticism
neuroticism.description: Measures emotional stability and stress management
neuroticism.high: More sensitive to stress and emotional fluctuations
neuroticism.low: Emotionally stable, calm and manage stress well

explanation.title: DISC Assessment - Behavioral Styles
explanation.description: DISC is a behavioral assessment that identifies your preferred work style and communication preferences based on four primary dimensions.

interpretation.general: The DISC assessment identifies your dominant behavioral style based on four key dimensions: Dominance, Influence, Steadiness, and Conscientiousness.
interpretation.dominant: Your dominant style is {{profile}}, which represents your preferred approach to tasks and interactions.

D.name: Dominance
D.description: Direct, results-oriented, firm, strong-willed, and forceful. You enjoy challenges and taking action to achieve results.

I.name: Influence
I.description: Outgoing, enthusiastic, optimistic, high-spirited, and lively. You enjoy interacting with people and influencing outcomes through communication.

S.name: Steadiness
S.description: Even-tempered, accommodating, patient, humble, and tactful. You prefer stable environments and collaborative teamwork.

C.name: Conscientiousness
C.description: Private, analytical, logical, critical, and systematic. You focus on accuracy, expertise, and quality in your work.

scoring.title: Understanding Your DISC Scores
scoring.description: Your DISC results show the relative strength of each behavioral style.
scoring.whatItMeans: Higher scores indicate stronger behavioral tendencies in that dimension.

D.workStyle: You thrive in challenging, fast-paced environments where you can take charge and drive results.
D.communication: You prefer direct, concise communication and appreciate when others get straight to the point.
D.decisionMaking: You make decisions quickly and confidently, often willing to take calculated risks.
D.stressResponse: Under pressure, you become more assertive and may take control of situations.

I.workStyle: You excel in collaborative, people-focused environments with variety and social interaction.
I.communication: You communicate enthusiastically and prefer face-to-face or verbal interactions.
I.decisionMaking: You consider the people impact of decisions and seek input from others.
I.stressResponse: Under pressure, you may become more talkative and seek support from others.

S.workStyle: You prefer stable, predictable environments with clear processes and team collaboration.
S.communication: You communicate thoughtfully and prefer one-on-one or small group discussions.
S.decisionMaking: You take time to consider all options and prefer consensus-building approaches.
S.stressResponse: Under pressure, you may become more withdrawn and seek stability.

C.workStyle: You excel in structured environments that value accuracy, analysis, and systematic approaches.
C.communication: You prefer written communication and detailed, fact-based discussions.
C.decisionMaking: You gather extensive data and analyze thoroughly before making decisions.
C.stressResponse: Under pressure, you may become more critical and focus on potential problems.
